head.supplied: 12th August 1864 ¶ ¶ I have the honor to inform you that it has been notified to this Department by the hon ¶ ; ¶ the Commisioner of Trade and Customs that the person named in the margin ¶ having t...

div.p: B3524, unit 7, VPRS 1187 outward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

I have the honor to inform you that it has been notified to this Department by the hon; the Commisioner of Trade and Customs that the person named in the margin
John Jackson, 46 Elizabeth Street, Melbourne.
I tried to find what trade or services he was in, but failed.Not in Govt Gazette; newspapers are not easy in this case because so many Jacksons, and the address hasn't helped. There was a letter to the editor written from 46 Elizabeth Street in the Argus 7 July 1864, pl 7, but signed Wm M'Culloch. There was a report of a fire in the premises of Brown & Reid, tea merchants and coffe roasters at that address in Leader of 3 December 1864, p. 2; A notice by the solicitor James Marshall acting for an insolvent also gave that address, Herald, 5 August, 1864, p. 4. The Herald of 9 November 1864 p 4 carried an advert for a firm of wine and spirit merchantsm De Pass Brothers & co, also at that address. And so on. Similalry for 1863. So what sort of an address was it. The 1864 Sands & McDougall's directory shows that the building was on East side of Elizabteh street, adjacent to Gibson Lane and was occupied by
J Simpson, sign painter,
A P Adcock notary Public
J Marshal, solicitor &c
W McCulloch, carrier,
Brown and Reid tea warehouse (whuch seems to have ben entered from the Lane, if I read the text correctly
Note that some of the advertisers are not in this list
Unfortunately the on-line 1864 Directory seems to be incomplete, and does not have the Alphabetical section past p. 279, ending Glover, Mrs
1863 directory on line ends at p. 257, at Heymanson, W.
1865 doesn't go past Henderson, Hugh Blacksmith.
These consulted at the Univ Melbourne site, which says that due toi the size of the document it has been created as several files, but I can't see to be able to getto the end of the documents.
SLV has every fifth year, but I can't get them to open beyond the front page of the site, that has options to go to different sections, but they don’t display, or at least I can't get them to do so.
having tendered to perform certain works for the customs Department without having the means of carrying out the same and subsequently withdrawing his tender has been disqualified for twelve months from tendering in connexion with that branch of the public Service
